King]] | website = [http://www.booboodavis.com Official website] | notable_instruments = }} '''James "Boo Boo" Davis''' (born November 4, 1943){{cite web | url=http://www.stlblues.net/Davis1Bio.htm | title=Boo Boo Davis Bio | publisher=STLBLues | accessdate=2011-06-23}} is an [[United States|American]] [[electric blues]] [[musician]]. Davis is one of the few remaining blues musicians that got experience singing the blues based on first-hand experience in the [[Mississippi Delta]], having sung to help pass the time while picking the [[cotton]] [[field (agriculture)|field]]s.{{cite web | url=http://www.booboodavis.com/biography.html | title=Boo Boo Davis Bio | publisher=Black & Tan Records | accessdate=2011-06-23}} ==Biography== ===Early life=== Davis was born in [[Drew, Mississippi]], where he was raised in the heart of Mississippi Delta. Davis's passion for music started at age five when his mother took him to church and he played the harmonica and sang.{{cite web | url=http://www.crossroads.nl/crossroads/artist/bbd.html | title=Boo Boo Davis Bio | publisher=Crossroads | accessdate=2011-06-23}} When he was eighteen years old he began playing drums for the family band, Lard Can Band, because Davis did not possess a [[drum kit]] and was forced to play on a lard can. The band featured his multi-instrumental father, Sylvester Sr., his younger brother Sylvester Jr. on the guitar, and his sister Clara on vocals. The band played throughout the state of Mississippi, including a stint as the back up for [[B.B King]], who was unknown at the time. {{Expand section|date=October 2011}} Davis's song "I'm So Tired", was used in a [[television commercial]] for [[5-Hour Energy]] and an episode of [[Sons of Anarchy]]. ==Discography== ===Albums=== *''East St. Louis'' (2001) *''Can Man'' (2002) *''Snake'' (2004) *(2006) *''Name of the Game'' (2008) *''Ain't Gotta Dime'' (2009) *''Undercover Blues'' (2011) *"I'm a Belieber" (2013) *"What Kind of Shit Is This?"
